html.p: Now, let's make sure your frog meets the criteria for a strong column 1. Here is your frog:

pb-mcq.name: frog-happy
pb-mcq.question: Is this frog happy for you?
pb-mcq.pb-tip: Great. Your frog should be happy for you.
In the end, all the feedback you have gotten from others should not lead you to choose a frog that does not also feel happy and important to you.

pb-tip.p: If a frog is happy for you, that means it is a frog that you genuinely feel in your own heart to be something that you want to improve. What is in your heart?

pb-mcq.name: frog-implicate
pb-mcq.question: Does this frog implicate you?
pb-mcq.pb-tip: Great. Your frog should implicate you.

pb-tip.p: Since the Trial of Uruk-Shan focuses on your own growth and change, it is important to be clear about the ways you are hoping to change and improve.

pb-mcq.pb-tip: Your frog implicates you if it is clear that you must get better at something. Your frog should focus on something you can control.

pb-rating.name: frog-important
pb-rating.low: Not at all important to me
pb-rating.question: How important is it to you?
pb-rating.pb-tip: The Trial of Uruk-Shan helps you uncover some of the core beliefs and assumptions you have held that are preventing you from making change.
A frog is important if it is one that could make a big difference in helping you reach your frogs in your work life or your personal life (or both).

problem-builder.pb-message: Great! You have indicated that you have chosen a frog that is happy for you, implicates you, has room for improvement, and is important to you. You are now ready to move onto the next step.
